title: Cost of Implementation of Basel III reforms in Bangladesh -- A Panel data analysis. (arXiv:2303.11414v1 [q-fin.RM])
abstract: Inspired by the recent debate on the macroeconomic implications of the new bank regulatory standards known as Basel III, we tried to find out in this study that the impact of Basel III liquidity and capital requirements in Bangladesh proposed by Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS, 2010a). A small set of macro variables, using a sample of 22 private commercial banks operating in Bangladesh for the period of 2010-2014, are used to estimate long-run relationships among the variables. The macroeconomic variables are included The profitability of banks, GDP, banks' lending to private sector, Net Stable Funding Ratio, Tier 1 capital Ratio, Interest rate spread, real interest rate. The cost is quantified using Driscoll and Kraay panel data models with fixed effect. translated_title: 孟加拉国实施巴塞尔协议III改革的成本 - 面板数据分析
translated_abstract: 受最近有关新银行监管标准巴塞尔协议III宏观经济影响的争论的启发，本研究旨在找出巴塞尔银行监管委员会（BCBS，2010a）提出的巴塞尔III流动性和资本要求对孟加拉国的影响。使用22家在孟加拉国运营的私营商业银行2010-2014年的样本，利用少量宏观变量估计变量之间的长期关系。宏观经济变量包括银行的盈利能力、GDP、银行向私人部门的借贷、净稳定资金比率、一级资本比率、利差和实际利率。使用Driscoll和Kraay面板数据模型以固定效应进行定量成本估算。更高的资本和流动性要求对银行的稳定性的影响被认为是收益，而对银行利差和向私人部门贷款的影响被视为整个经济的成本。
tldr: 本研究旨在发现孟加拉国实施巴塞尔III改革的成本和收益，通过面板数据分析发现更高的资本和流动性要求对银行的稳定性为收益，对银行利差和向私人部门贷款的影响为成本。
en_tdlr: This study aims to find out the costs and benefits of implementing Basel III reforms in Bangladesh. Through panel data analysis, it was found that higher capital and liquidity requirements have benefits for the stability of banks, while the impact on banks' interest rate spread and lending to private sector are considered as costs for the economy.
